result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Luis Ott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on 10/7/22 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 12/31/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept. Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

charges.descr: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Luis Ott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Joseph Luis Ott.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 35 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 35 DAYS TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by 12/31/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/7/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Joseph Luis Ott.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time to negotiations. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference called earlier this morning. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests to pass the case until the afternoon to allow time to speak with the defendant.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and needs an offer.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Comfort Suites and its employees
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Luis Ott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4/26/2022. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/26/2022@2:00pm
